title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Mertoun, i.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Well, I can work at something, so at the_Magnum_ work I. The day was indeed broken, great part having beenemployed in the return from Mertoun.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: When I returned from Mertoun, half-frozen, I took up the _Magnum_,and began to notify the romance called _Woodstock_, in which I got someassistance from Harden's ancient tracts.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Arrived at Mertoun, and found with the family Sir John Pringle, MajorPringle, and Charles Baillie.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Anne sets off to Mertoun, and I remain alone.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: We returned fromMertoun after breakfast through an incipient snowstorm, coming onpartially, and in great flakes, the sun bursting at intervals throughthe clouds.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: We wentto dine and pass the night at Mertoun, where we met Sir John Pringle,Mr. and Mrs. Baillie Mellerstain, and their daughters.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Indolence is a delightful indulgence, but atwhat a rate we purchase it! To-day we go to Mertoun, and having spentsome time in making up my Journal to this length, and in a chat withCaptain John, who dropped in, I will presently set to the review--knockit off, if possible, before we start at five o'clock.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: _October_ 25.--We arrived at Mertoun yesterday, and heard with somesurprise that George had gone up in an air balloon, and ascended twomiles and a half above this sublunary earth.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: I didnot attempt to work, especially as we were going down to Mertoun, andset off at five o'clock.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: _October_ 17.--Drove down to Mertoun and brought up Elizabeth Scott tobe our guest for some days or so.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Anne, who had been at Mertoun the day before,brought up Anne and Elizabeth Scott[33] with her, and Francis has beenwith us since yesterday.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: _August_ 29.--Went on our little expedition, breakfasting at Mertoun.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Walked from twelve till three, then droveto Mertoun with Lockhart and Allan.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: A drive down to Mertoun, and engaged to dine there on Sundayfirst.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Walter and Janedined at Mertoun.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Anne and I dined at Mertoun, as has been my old wont and use asChristmas day comes about.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: _July_ 21.--To Mertoun we went accordingly.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: But as I go to Mertoun at four, and spend the night there, theexertion was necessary.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: I went down to Mertoun withColonel Ferguson, who returned to dine here, which consumed time so muchthat I made a short day's work.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Mertoun, i.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Well, I can work at something, so at the Magnum work I. The day was indeed broken,  great part having been employed in the return from Mertoun.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Arrived at Mertoun, and found with the family Sir John Pringle, Major Pringle, and Charles Baillie.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Anne sets off to Mertoun, and I remain alone.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: We returned from Mertoun after breakfast through an incipient snowstorm, coming on partially, and in great flakes, the sun bursting at intervals through the clouds.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: We went to dine and pass the night at Mertoun, where we met Sir John Pringle, Mr. and Mrs. Baillie Mellerstain, and their daughters.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Indolence is a delightful indulgence, but at what a rate we purchase it ! To-day we go to Mertoun, and having spent some time in making up my Journal to this length, and in a chat with Captain John, who dropped  in, I will presently set to the review knock it off, if possible, before we start at five o'clock.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: We arrived at Mertoun yesterday, and heard with some surprise that George had gone up in an air balloon, and ascended  two miles and a half above this sublunary earth.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: I did not attempt to work, especially as we were going down to Mertoun, and set off at five o'clock.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Drove down to Mertoun and brought up Elizabeth Scott to be our guest for some days or so.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Anne, who had been at Mertoun the day before, brought up Anne and Elizabeth Scott 2 with her, and Francis has been with us since yesterday.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Went on our little expedition, breakfasting at Mertoun.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Walked from twelve till three, then drove to Mertoun with Lockhart and Allan.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: A drive down to Mertoun, and engaged to dine there on Sunday first.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Walter  and Jane dined at Mertoun.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Anne and I dined at Mertoun, as has been my old wont and use as Christmas day comes about.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: To Mertoun we went accordingly.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: But as I go to Mertoun at four, and spend the night there, the exertion was necessary.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: I went down to Mertoun with Colonel Ferguson, who returned to dine here, which consumed time so much that I made a short day's work.
